1 Bein

2 Beide Poden (dual)

As always the original form might have being more complex, and related to jamb jump.
However the core of the sign is pretty stable and recognisable:

Many Egyptian words which have the character â€˜ğ“ƒ€â€™ now have a â€˜bâ€™ in its derived coptic forms, or similar bh,ph,p sounds in modern variants of the word â€˜ğ“ƒ€â€™ (all meaning leg~foot)

the original form mentioned above might be connected to the other larg â€˜leg clusterâ€™ shin:
Schienbein SNB~JMB jamb

sune : leg, shin  
ashi : leg, foot, pace, gait  
ashi : leg  
ato-ashi : hind leg (anti-)  
mukouzune : shin, front of lower leg
